title: TSV 1860 Munich - Wikipedia
snippet: 1860 came close to insolvency for a second time in five years in 2011 when it needed €8 million to survive. Help was offered to the club by local rival Bayern Munich, to the disgust of the supporters of each club, since Bayern was to lose €50 million in future stadium rent if the club defaulted on its rental contract obligations until 2025...

title: Germany: TSV 1860 could expand stadium to 25,000 seats – StadiumDB.com
snippet: During the construction period, Grünwalder Stadium will be unavailable for matches, meaning TSV 1860 would have to temporarily move to the Olympiastadion. The club plans to carefully evaluate this option as well.

title: Grünwalder Stadion - Wikipedia
snippet: The stadium is known for its curved western terrace known as the Westkurve, where currently 9,000 1860 Munich fans stand creating an impressive atmosphere. Bayern Munich II also play at the stadium, but only open the covered seated Nordtribune to home fans for matches.
